title: Pair of former Red Sox saves Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts' two-run single in the third helped Dodgers take a 3-0 lead over Blue Jays in Game 6.
Kiké Hernandez made a crucial outfield play, preventing Blue Jays from tying the game in the ninth inning.
Dodgers' 3-1 win over Blue Jays in Game 6 forces a decisive Game 7 in the World Series.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff dressed up and distributed candy on the T, featuring Wizard of Oz characters and 'T princess.'
New England Patriots engaged fans with costume submissions, while Celtics' Jayson Tatum visited Boston Children's Hospital.
Boston Medical Center's NICU featured costumes for babies, with some made by nurses or donated by Project Sweet Peas.

title: A winning Powerball ticket remains unclaimed in Mass. — and expires next month
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A $50,000 Powerball ticket sold in Marlborough, Massachusetts remains unclaimed, with a claim deadline of November 20, 2025.
The winning Quic Pic ticket was purchased at New Capital Farms Convenience Store for the November 20, 2024 drawing.
If unclaimed, the $50,000 prize will be redistributed to Massachusetts' 351 cities and towns, according to state lottery officials.

title: W. Va. couple had their dream Halloween wedding in Salem
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Thaddeus and Danielle Martin from West Virginia married on Halloween at Salem's Willows Park.
The couple wore Halloween-themed attire; the bride dressed in black and carried black and red flowers.
Justice of the Peace Penny Richards officiated; the ceremony was captured by Jay Willet for WBZ.

title: Jaylen Brown continues to shine as Celtics hold off furious 76ers run, win third straight: 9 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown led the Celtics with 32 points on 13-for-19 shooting, securing a 109-108 victory over the 76ers.
The Celtics held off a comeback by the 76ers, improving to a .500 record and winning their NBA Cup Group B opener.
The Celtics and 76ers each recorded 56 rebounds, with Boston excelling in offensive boards, grabbing 16 against Philadelphia's 9.

title: Julia Fox defends controversial Jackie O. Halloween costume
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Julia Fox wore a bloodied Jackie Kennedy costume, stating it as a political statement rather than a costume.
Kennedy's grandson, Jack Schlossberg, criticized Fox's Halloween costume as 'disgusting' and glorifying political violence.
Fox defended her costume, citing Jackie Kennedy's refusal to change clothes as an act of bravery and protest.

title: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr., WR Drake London set to play vs. Patriots
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Falcons QB Michael Penix Jr. and WR Drake London will play against the Patriots after recovering from injuries.
Penix and London participated fully in practice, having missed the Falcons' last game versus the Dolphins.
The 3-4 Falcons face the 6-2 Patriots, with London among the top-ranked receivers this season.

title: Craig Breslow believes Red Sox are in ‘improved position’ to get ‘right players’ this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow believes the Red Sox are in a better position to acquire top talent this offseason.
The team faces potential roster challenges with Alex Bregman's opt-out and player options for Lucas Giolito and Trevor Story.
The Red Sox have roughly $25 million under the first luxury tax threshold and a strong farm system for roster improvements.

title: Mike Vrabel says recent Patriots changes have nothing to do with wanting to separate from the past
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mike Vrabel insists changes in Patriots norms aim at improving performance, not distancing from past success.
Recent changes include individual introductions for offensive starters, replacing a 24-year tradition.
Patriots lead AFC East with a 6-2 record under Vrabel, despite some challenges in implementing new practices.

title: Bruins’ Elias Lindholm will miss ‘a few weeks’, Khusnutdinov promoted to 1C
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Elias Lindholm will miss several weeks due to a lower-body injury from a collision in the game against Buffalo.
Bruins coach Marco Sturm confirms Marat Khusnutdinov will replace Lindholm as the first-line center.
Lindholm's absence impacts the Bruins' power play, where he scored four goals this season.
